question: Question_06_(c)
statement:
Is your approximation for $\sqrt[3]{7}$ too large or too small? Explain.
Use the information together with the error bound you found in
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH104/December_2013/Question_06_(b)}{part
(b)} to construct the smallest interval you can guarantee contains the
true value of $\sqrt[3]{7}.$
sols:
Since the double derivative on (0,\textbackslash{}infty) is negative,
the function is concave down there. Thus, the tangent line is an over
estimate of the function. Hence, our true value must lie in the interval

$\displaystyle [23/12 - 2\cdot7^{-5/3}/9,23/12]$
